plugins.name: Variables Inspector
plugins.description:
Using complex variables and logic in Figma, but can't find a way to debug when things don't wok as expected?


Variables Inspector will show current values of variables as an overlay on every frame. You can quickly see and isolate what is going wrong and make changes to fix them.


  1. The inspector works in both design and prototype modes.
  2. The inspector supports variable values with more than one mode.



Instructions

See video tutorial here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jFM4NPntaaI

  1. Open the desired page and run the plugin (file should contain at least one variable, no pranks please!).
  2. Choose the variable collection you would like to inspect and click Show Inspector.
  3. Plugin will add Inspector to all the frames in the current page, listing the variables and their current values.
  4. Added Inspector is visible in prototypes as well and will update in real-time, when variable values change.
  5. Go debug that pesky variable that is driving you nuts.
  6. Close the plugin when you no longer need the Inspector.

accepted.name: Vivek G
accepted.description: Product designer, half developer and everything tech in between!

plugins.tagline: Debug your variables in designs and prototypes. The missing DevTools for Figma variables.

plugins.name: Base page setup for design files
plugins.description:
Usage

Create a new Figma design file then run this plugin to start off with a set of organized pages. (the plugin will create the pages then remove the default "Page 1" from your file, so make sure its empty)


Context

Our team likes to use this structure to organize pages in our files because it helps separate the different stages of the design process, this plugin creates all the base pages needed in one click.


Each page serves as a "header" for all the sub pages that go in that section and an empty page is added in between each for spacing and readability purposes.


Page Structure:


--- Final ---

-

--- Iterating designs ---

-

--- Ideating ---

-

--- Research ---

-

--- Cover --- 


Suggested use of structure

Below each of the headers add your pages that fall into that stage:

  • Final: final designs ready for handoff
  • Iterating designs: working files of hifi design explorations and versioning.
  • Ideating : rough mocks, flow diagrams, wireframes, rough explorations.
  • Research: key info from interviews, PM notes, references, inspiration, competition analysis, etc…
  • Cover: for the project cover.
plugins.tagline: Run this plugin after creating a new file to create a base set of pages for a design project

plugins.name: ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers
plugins.description:
ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers


Transform your UI designs with comprehensive analysis, accessibility insights, and visual attention mapping to boost conversions


ClarityUX is the ultimate design intelligence companion for Figma users seeking to perfect their interfaces. Our powerful AI analyzes your design files to provide actionable improvements, WCAG compliance checks, attention heat-maps, and detailed UX recommendations—all in one seamless workflow.


🔍 Key Features


Comprehensive Design Analysis using Groq and Gemini AI

- Composition Analysis: Get detailed feedback on visual hierarchy, balance, and layout structure

- Design Improvement Suggestions: Receive actionable recommendations to enhance your designs

- UX Enhancement Insights: Uncover opportunities to improve user experience and flow


Attention Heatmaps

- Visual Attention Mapping: See exactly where users will focus their attention

- Focus Area Analysis: Identify key areas drawing user attention and potential blind spots

- Interactive Heatmaps: Dynamically visualize user attention patterns across your designs



Powerful Insights

- Element-by-Element Review: Get detailed feedback on specific components and sections

- Data-Backed Recommendations: All suggestions supported by UX research and best practices

- Export Capabilities: Share insights with your team for collaborative improvement


💯 Benefits


- Save Time: Automate the design review process and focus on creative work

- Improve Quality: Create more user-friendly and accessible designs

- Data-Driven Decisions: Base design choices on objective predictive analysis rather than guesswork

- Learn & Grow: Develop better design instincts through AI-powered feedback


🚀 Getting Started


1. Select design elements you want to analyze

2. Choose which analysis tools to run (Design Review, Heatmap)

3. Review insights and implement suggested improvements


ClarityUX works with all Figma design elements including frames, artboards, groups, and components.


Perfect for UI/UX designers, product teams, and design agencies looking to create exceptional user experiences backed by data and accessibility best practices.


Upgrade your design workflow with ClarityUX today!

[3 free credits Included for new users and a 14 day trial]

plugins.name: figma转html代码 Figma to html
plugins.description:
Introduction】

This plugin allows you to convert selected Figma elements into HTML and CSS, offering the ability to preview and download the generated code. It's a helpful tool for designers and developers who want to quickly transform their designs into functional HTML structure and styling.


Function Description

  1. Convert Figma elements (frames, text, shapes, etc.) into HTML and CSS.
  2. Preview the generated HTML and CSS in real time.
  3. Copy the generated HTML and CSS code to your clipboard.
  4. Download the HTML file with embedded CSS for immediate use.


How to Use

  1. Select the desired elements in your Figma design.
  2. Click the "Generate HTML & CSS" button.
  3. View the generated HTML and CSS, then copy or download the code as needed.
  4. Preview the output directly in the plugin interface.


Notes

  1. Ensure you have selected the correct Figma elements before generating code.
  2. For more complex designs, ensure that all layers and frames are properly named and structured for better results.
  3. Generated HTML and CSS may need some manual adjustments depending on your requirements.


介绍

该插件允许您将选中的 Figma 元素转换为 HTML 和 CSS，并支持实时预览和下载生成的代码。对于希望快速将设计转换为功能性 HTML 结构和样式的设计师和开发人员来说，这是一个非常实用的工具。


功能说明

  1. 将 Figma 元素（框架、文本、形状等）转换为 HTML 和 CSS。
  2. 实时预览生成的 HTML 和 CSS。
  3. 复制生成的 HTML 和 CSS 代码到剪贴板。
  4. 下载包含嵌入式 CSS 的 HTML 文件，立即使用。


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 设计中选择需要的元素。
  2. 点击“Generate HTML & CSS”按钮。
  3. 查看生成的 HTML 和 CSS 代码，并根据需要复制或下载代码。
  4. 在插件界面中直接预览输出结果。


注意事项

  1. 确保在生成代码之前已正确选择 Figma 元素。
  2. 对于更复杂的设计，请确保所有图层和框架命名正确且结构合理，以获得更好的效果。
  3. 生成的 HTML 和 CSS 可能需要根据您的需求进行手动调整。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Convert Figma elements to HTML/CSS, with download

plugins.name: Variants Manager
plugins.description:
Quickly find and replace property names, enforce naming rules, and work seamlessly across multiple pages or within specific selections.


Find & Replace

Ever needed to rename a specific property name through out your design system? Instead of going through each page, trying to see which components has that property name or property value is a pain. This plugin allows you to quickly find & replace your property names.


Lint

Enforcing naming conventions is good. Choose your naming convention for component names, property names and property values and see which components have lint errors. Replace all of them in an instant.


Supported Naming Conventions

  • camelCase
  • PascalCase
  • snake_case
  • kebab-case


Support & Feature Request

plugins.name: Interface Architecture (IA)
plugins.description:
Interface Architecture (IA) is a lightweight Figma plugin that lets users tag, organize, and share designs in a central repository for quick discovery and reuse across multiple files. Create nested folders to structure your product, save important frames/sections/components for quick reference, and share them effortlessly with your team.


The plugin streamlines your workflow by allowing you to save any Figma frame with a simple copy-paste of its URL. Each frame can be previewed directly within the plugin, making it easy to find and reference specific designs without switching between files.


Free users can get started with 10 folders and 25 frames, perfect for individual use or small teams. For unlimited storage and advanced features, upgrade to our Pro plan.


Getting started is simple: Install the plugin, create an account, and begin organizing your frames into custom folders. Use Command + L (⌘L) to copy any frame's URL, then paste it into the plugin to save it. Search functionality helps you quickly locate frames across all your folders.


Perfect for:

• Design system management

• Component libraries

• Project documentation

• Team collaboration

• Design reviews


Pro features include:

• Unlimited folders and frames

• Priority support

• More features coming soon

accepted.name: Matt Giorgio
accepted.description: Software Designer based in Adelaide, Australia

plugins.tagline: Tag, organize & share designs in a central repository for quick discovery and reuse across files.

plugins.name: Structure Cleaner
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you quickly remove all frames that do not affect the overall design, i.e. those that contain additional single frames and do not have any properties such as color. Such frames do not fulfill any grouping or visual role, so they can be considered unnecessary.


Plugin offers two levels of restructuring level options:

  1. Hard - this option removes every redundant frame even with padding applied - you can then add it on remaining frames to have the same effect.
  2. Soft - this option removes only redundant frames with no padding aplied.


Simply select the frames you want to clean, choose your desired action, and the plugin will efficiently process your selection, helping you maintain a cleaner and more organized design structure. If no redundant frames are found, it will notify you of the clean status.
plugins.tagline: Keep your structure clean and remove unnecessary single-child frames. that have no properties.

  1. Hard - this option removes every redundant frame even with padding applied - you can then add it on remaining frames to have the same effect.
  2. Soft - this option removes only redundant frames with no padding aplied.


Simply select the frames you want to clean, choose your desired action, and the plugin will efficiently process your selection, helping you maintain a cleaner and more organized design structure. If no redundant frames are found, it will notify you of the clean status.
96655.tagline: Keep your structure clean and remove unnecessary single-child frames. that have no properties.

plugins.name: MakeData AI Data Generator
plugins.description:
Easily create, replace, or translate data in your Figma files.


This plugin is a practical, easy way to use AI to generate data for your Figma projects and wireframes. The plugin excels at data formatted in horizontal rows like a spreadsheet - perfect for representing data tables, inventories, price lists, work lists, and any other layout that features classic columns and rows of data. You supply the table design. The plugin will fill it up with data that is as generic or specific as you need it to be.


The plugin supports three modes - Create data, Replace data, and Translate.


Here is a playground file for you to try it out.


In "Create" mode, you will be inserting new text layers on your canvas or in a selected frame based on column headers that you select. Additionally, you can use the Prompt field to provide additional instructions or context - for example if you want the generated data to reflect a specific industry or topic. The resulting data follows the formatting of your column headers, but of course you can format the data any way you want.


"Replace" mode allows you to select a table component or instance - such as a template - and replace the text layers inside it with newly generated data. For example, if your template has "Text" in every data cell, the plugin will replace "Text" with data that you request (also reading your column headers and prompt).


The plugin also stores your recent prompts for easy recall and reuse.


Translate mode allows you to select text layers, frames, or components and have the text translated to a target language. Translate works with any selected text layers, frames or components, not just those in a table.


Additional notes:


  • This version of the plugin generates data formatted into horizontal rows like a spreadsheet.
  • Results are returned from a custom GPT engine optimized to generate results in table format.
  • You can request data for nearly any domain - factual or fictional.
  • The plugin will not return sensitive, protected, inappropriate or private data.
  • There are no set limits to the number of rows and columns the plugin can manage, but there are practical limits based on the underlying AI engine. As this technology improves over time, so will the performance and scale of this plugin.
  • Most requests for table data of about 25 rows or less should return successfully within a minute.
  • The response time will depend on the complexity of the request and the amount of data requested.
  • You can get more rows if you have fewer columns; conversely, you can generate more columns by requesting fewer rows.
  • If your request is not working, try triming back your table's dimensions or the number of rows requested.


Working with prompts:

Your table's column headers are evaluated by the AI to create matching data. E.g. a column header of "Date" will produce dates with no further instructions. If you want your date field to be formatted in a specific way or to tell a story, you can use the Prompt field to provide those instructions, such as "Date field in MM-DD-YYYY format."

  • A prompt is optional. Sometimes the column headers alone are descriptive enough to generate presentable data.
  • The prompt field is there to allow you to guide the results more specifically. There are many, many uses for a prompt. Here are just a few:
  • Only valid values from a reference list that you supply in the prompt.
  • Distribution percentages of values. E.g. if your table has an "availability" column, you can tell the AI that you want 20% of the items in your list to be "Out of stock."
  • Language; e.g. "All results in Spanish"
  • The Prompt History feature keeps your last 25 different prompts so that you can reuse them by copying and pasting.
  • Only new or edited prompts are saved. Using the same prompt repeatedly will not count towards the 25.


Enjoy!

accepted.name: MakeData.ai
accepted.description: Chief Product Officer at MakeData.ai

plugins.tagline: Create, Replace, or Translate Data in Components, Frames, or on the Canvas

plugins.name: Variables Ultra｜Management, Rebind, Import & Export, Templates
plugins.description:
Variables Ultra | Management, Rebind, Import & Export, Templates


Variables Ultra is a powerful variable management plugin that implements almost all of the vanilla variable management functionalities in Figma, but with some differences.

We have optimized it based on user feedback and added several premium features such as `Import/Export`, `Variable Rebinding`, and `Generating Variable Set Templates`, among others.


⚡️ Quick Start


After opening the plugin, create your variable collection.


  1. A brand new, unified UI/UX design
  2. Place `Collection` in the same viewport to avoid dropdown menus, enabling quick selection
  3. Click the icon button before the variable name to view/edit details
  4. More user-friendly options for single selection, multi-selection, and select all
  5. More intuitive linking of variables (alias), making operations smoother
  6. Batch modification of multiple variable's scopes


---


One More Thing


  1. [Variable Rebinding]
  2. [Import/Export]
  3. [Material3 Specification Templates]


Please note, these features require a valid subscription to unlock.


---


Variable Rebinding


Want to switch themes?

Modes amount limit?

Use variable sets as your themes to quickly switch different variable

sets for layers, making theme switch effortless.


Follow these steps to prepare:

  1. Prepare two variable sets with different names to represent your different themes.
  2. Create a variable set `Collection A` and create a variable `background`.
  3. Create a variable set `Collection B` and create a variable `background`.
  4. Select any layer and bind its Fill to a variable.
  5. Open the plugin and switch to the `Rebind Var` tab.
  6. Select `Collection A` in the Source and `Collection B` in the Target.
  7. Ensure the red layer is selected in Figma and press the `Rebind` button.
  8. You will see the layer's Fill rebind to `Collection B - background`.


This applies to any nested layers and any number of variables. For more usage, please try playground


Please note, `Rebind Var` cannot rebind the following attributes:

- Fill with gradient colors
- For rich text, you can only choose one of the following:
- Bind `String Variable` to Text Content
- Bind any variable to Text Style instead of the text content itself


---


Import and Export


We often need to apply variables to multiple Figma files, and manually recreating them one by one can be a massive task.


  1. We have prepared a Shared Collection:
  2. a-background links to Collection A - background
  3. b-background links to Collection B - background
  4. blue is set to #0000FF
  5. blue-alias links to blue
  6. a-background-alias links to a-background


Click the export button in the bottom right corner to generate a JSON file containing all the variable sets and variables.


2. Import


Switch to Import/Export tab and select the JSON file to import.


---


Material3 Specification Templates


Material3 specification templates are provided to help you quickly set up variables according to the Material3 design guidelines.


---


Variables Ultra是一款强大的变量管理插件，实现了几乎所有香草的变量管理的功能，但又不完全一样，我们统计了一些样本，专门针对使用体验进行了优化，同时也增加了一些付费功能: 导入/导出、变量重绑定、生成变量集模板等等



⚡️ 快速开始


打开插件后，创建你的变量集


  1. 全新且统一设计语言的 UI/UX
  2. 将 `Collection` 放入同一视口避免使用下拉框，方便快速选择
  3. 点击变量名前面的图标按钮以查看/编辑详情
  4. 更人性化的单选、多选、全选
  5. 更人性化的链接变量（别名），操作更流畅
  6. 批量修改多个变量的可选范围


---


One more thing


  1. [变量重绑定](#变量重绑定)
  2. [导入/导出](#导入和导出)
  3. [Material3 规范模版](#Material3规范模版)


> 请注意，这些功能需要一个可用的订阅以解锁


---


变量重绑定

想要切换主题？Mode数量限制？使用变量集作为你的主题，快速为图层切换不同的变量集合，轻松实现主题替换


为你的设计增加一个不同的主题风格，很简单。


你需要按照以下步骤做一些准备：

  1. 准备两个不同名称的变量集，以表示你的不同主题
  2. 创建变量集 Collection A，并创建变量 background
  3. 创建变量集 Collection B，并创建变量 background
  4. 选择任意一个图层，将它的 Fill 绑定一个变量，比如 Collection A - backgroud
  5. 打开插件，切换到 Rebind Var 标签页
  6. 在 Source Collection 中选择 Collection A
  7. 在 Target Collection 中选择 Collection B
  8. 确保在 figma 中已经选中了红色图层，并按下 Rebind 按钮


最终你会看到图层的 Fill ，重新绑定到 Collection B - backgroud


***这适用于任意嵌套的图层，以及任意数量的变量。更多的用法请尝试playground***


> 请注意，Rebind Var 无法对以下属性进行重新绑定

  1. 带有渐变颜色的 Fill
  2. 对于富文本来说，你只能在以下二选一

- 将 String Variable 绑定到 Text Content

- 将任意变量绑定到 Text Style 而不是文本内容本身


---


导入和导出


我们经常需要将变量应用到多个 figma 文件中，一个一个手动重建将会是一个巨大的工程。但现在有了导入/导出，只需要两个按钮就可以做到


  1. 让我们准备一个 `Shared Collection`
  2. a-background 链接到 Collection A - backgroud
  3. b-background 链接到 Collection B - backgroud
  4. blue 设置为 #0000FF
  5. blue-alias 链接到 blue
  6. a-background-alias 链接到 a-background


点击右下角的导出按钮，将会生成一个 json 文件，包含了所有的变量集和变量


2. 导入

1. 切换到 Import Var 标签页，并选择刚才导出的 json 文件

2. 正如我们刚才导出的一样，你会看到所有的变量集和它们的依赖关系

3. 选择需要导入的变量集，对于有依赖关系的变量集，插件会自动导入依赖的变量集

4. 点击导入按钮，完成操作


---


Material3规范模版


只需要选择一个种子色，即可生成一个 Material3 规范的变量集

生成多个变量集，即可使用 `Rebind Var` 功能，快速切换主题

accepted.name: Balamia
accepted.description: balamiadesign@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Variable Rebinding, JSON export, optional variable import, and M3-compliant template generation.

plugins.name: Aspect Ratio Lock
plugins.description:
Preserve Aspect Ratios While Resizing

Aspect Ratio Lock helps you create aspect ratio containers in Figma, that maintain their intended proportions while resizing. Simply define your desired aspect ratio, choose your content type (image or component), and let the plugin handle the rest.


With intuitive auto layout features, your aspect ratios will adapt seamlessly to your content, enhancing both functionality and aesthetic appeal.


IMPORTANT: You will notice a diagonal line in every Aspect Ratio Unit. To remove this, locate the Aspect Ratio Keeper frame in the provided master component and change the height from 1 to 0.
plugins.tagline: Create containers that preserve the Aspect Ratio of your Images & Components while resizing.

plugins.name: Rubik's Puzzle
plugins.description:
Create a 3×3 cube puzzle with country flags or random cube faces directly on your Figma canvas.


  1. Open the quick actions menu using Command + / (Mac) or Control + / (Windows).
  2. Search for "Rubik's Puzzle" and choose either "Country Flag" or "Random Face" from the list.
  3. The puzzle will be added to your Figma canvas.


Tip: To generate more puzzles quickly, use Option + Command + P (Mac) or Alt + Control + P (Windows) to re-run the plugin.

plugins.name: 数据生成图表可视化工具 Data Vision Chart
plugins.description:
Introduction

This is the basic version of the Data Vision chart generator plugin, designed to help users create simple and effective data visualizations such as line, bar, donut, and pie charts. It offers easy chart generation with customizable colors and exportable designs. For advanced features like more customization, additional chart types, and more robust data handling, please try the Data Vision Pro version.


Function Description

  1. Supports the creation of four chart types: Line, Bar, Donut, and Pie charts.
  2. Customizable colors with predefined themes for visual consistency.
  3. Ability to add and modify data rows easily within an intuitive UI.
  4. Export charts as Figma frames for further design adjustments.
  5. Multilingual support, including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.


Usage Instructions

  1. Choose the type of chart you want to create.
  2. Enter your data labels and values, and select a color scheme or customize colors.
  3. Set the chart dimensions, if needed, and click the "Generate Chart" button.
  4. View the generated chart as a Figma frame, and make further adjustments as needed.


Notes

  1. This basic version includes essential chart types and features.
  2. Ensure all data fields are filled out before generating a chart.
  3. For more chart types, advanced styling, and professional-level features, check out the Data Vision Pro version.


介绍

这是 Data Vision 图表生成器插件的基础版，旨在帮助用户轻松创建简单有效的数据可视化图表，包括折线图、柱状图、环形图和饼图。该版本支持自定义颜色和导出设计功能。欲体验更多自定义功能、额外的图表类型以及更强大的数据处理能力，请尝试 Data Vision Pro 版本。


功能说明

  1. 支持创建四种图表类型：折线图、柱状图、环形图和饼图。
  2. 提供预设主题色，可进行自定义配色。
  3. 用户界面直观，轻松添加和修改数据行。
  4. 可将生成的图表导出为 Figma 框架进行进一步设计。
  5. 支持多语言，包括英语、简体中文、繁体中文、印地语、日语和韩语。


使用方法

  1. 选择您需要生成的图表类型。
  2. 输入数据标签和数值，选择配色方案或自定义颜色。
  3. 设置图表尺寸（如果需要），然后点击“生成图表”按钮。
  4. 生成的图表将作为 Figma 框架显示，您可以进行进一步的调整。


注意事项

  1. 该基础版包含基本的图表类型和功能。
  2. 确保所有数据字段已填写完整后再生成图表。
  3. 如需更多图表类型、进阶样式和专业功能，请尝试 Data Vision Pro 版本。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Create basic charts effortlessly for data visualization.

plugins.name: Font-o-matic
plugins.description:
Creating a custom font couldn't be any simpler:

  1. Arrange your characters horizontally in this specific order: capital letters A-Z, lowercase a-z, digits 0-9, and punctuation characters !@#$%^&*()_+-={}[]|\:;"'<>,.?/`~ (there should be a total of 94)
  2. Launch Font-o-matic and select all 94 characters
  3. Specify a name for the font family, select the font weight, and optionally adjust the sidebearings
  4. Press "Forge Font"
  5. Click the "Download" link in the confirmation dialog


Support for additional languages and glyphs:

As of v3, Font-o-matic supports the addition of any Unicode characters you want to include in your font:

  1. Align any additional glyph shapes after the required 94. The order of the additional shapes does not matter.
  2. Label each shape layer (for the additional glyphs) with either a) the Unicode name in the format 'U+xxxx' or b) the single Unicode character it represents.
  3. Select all of your shapes, and the button should indicate how many of the required shapes plus how many extra shapes are selected.


Some helpful tips:

  1. Make sure the 94 required characters are in the correct order, or they will mismatch the unicode characters they're assigned to in the font.
  2. Properly scale all of your characters beforehand, and make sure they are proportionally sized relative to each other.
  3. The spacing between your characters does not matter, but the relative vertical alignment of your characters does and is taken into account when the plugin calculates the baseline, x-height, cap height, ascender and descender measurements. For example, your commas and periods should be close to the baseline of your letters.
  4. The larger your characters are, the less the calculations need to scale up your letters, and therefor the more precise your alignment will be. The emsquare that the plugin uses is 1000 units, so at 1000 pixels it would be 1:1, though even at 1:20 (50x50px) you should be more than fine.
  5. Some text editing programs automatically replace quotation pairs with directional quotation marks. If you wish to support these unique Unicode glyphs, make sure to add them as additional characters with labeled layers (U+2018, U+2019, U+201C & U+201D). Alternatively, if you do not include these glyphs Font-o-matic will duplicate your single and double quotes into these glyphs as a fallback so that they will not get substituted for a system default font.
plugins.tagline: Generate fonts directly from Figma

plugins.name: DataMapper Pro - Bulk Generate Frames From JSON
plugins.description:
Table of Contents

  1. Introduction
  2. Getting Started
  3. 2.1. Installation
  4. 2.2. Selecting a Frame
  5. Analyzing Your Template
  6. 3.1. Defining Data Types
  7. Importing JSON Data
  8. 4.1. Entry point and Delimiter
  9. Mapping Fields
  10. Generating Frames
  11. Disclaimers
  12. Reporting Bugs and Providing Feedback
  13. Contact Information

1. Introduction

DataMapper Pro is a Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of generating frame templates based on a JSON dataset. With this plugin, you can transform your design templates into dynamic data-driven frames. These frames can contain various types of data, including text, images, barcodes, and QR codes. This documentation will guide you through the usage and features of the plugin.

2. Getting Started


2.1. Installation

To use DataMapper Pro, follow these steps:

  1. Open Figma and create or open a design document.
  2. Navigate to the "Plugins" menu and select "Manage Plugins."
  3. Search for "DataMapper Pro" and click the "Install" button to add it to your Figma workspace.

2.2. Selecting a Frame

Before you can start generating templates, you must select a frame in your Figma design. This frame should contain the template fields that you want to map to your JSON data. Each template field must be labeled with a unique name starting with a # symbol. For example, #employeeName, #employeeId, and so on.

3. Analyzing Your Template

Once you've selected a frame, follow these steps:

  1. Click on the frame you've chosen in the Figma canvas.
  2. In the DataMapper Pro panel, click the "Analyze" button.

3.1. Defining Data Types

The plugin will list all the template fields within the frame. For each field, you need to select the appropriate data type. Supported data types include:

  • Text
  • Image (URL)
  • Barcode (CODE39)
  • QR Code

Ensure that you correctly assign data types to each field and then press the "Next" button.

4. Importing JSON Data

Once you've defined data types for your template fields, follow these steps:

  1. Click the "Import & Process" button in the plugin panel.
  2. You'll be prompted to upload a JSON file or provide a JSON URL.
  3. Additionally, you can specify the entry point within the JSON data using the '$' symbol for the root of the array or '$.data' for nested data arrays.
  4. There is also an option to set a delimiter (default is '-') to flatten nested objects in the JSON.

5. Mapping Fields

After importing your JSON data, the plugin will display a table for mapping fields. You can review and reassign the mappings for each field if necessary. Ensure that the mappings are correct, and press the "Generate" button.

6. Generating Frames

Upon pressing the "Generate" button, the plugin will generate frames for each data entry in the JSON array and place them in the same page. These frames will reflect the template fields you defined earlier.

7. Disclaimers

Please be aware of the following disclaimers:

  • The frame you select must be structured properly for the plugin to work effectively.
  • Only one frame can be processed at a time.
  • If the same name is used for multiple fields, the last defined data type will be used.
  • Fields with incorrect data types will be treated as text fields.
  • Concatenation of multiple fields is not supported.
  • Ensure that the provided URLs for JSON, images, QR codes, and barcodes are accessible via a simple GET request without authentication barriers.
  • If the image, QR code, or barcode data is invalid or too long, the default image will be used.
  • Large data arrays or images may take time to process or lead to plugin instability. It's recommended to use smaller data chunks.

8. Reporting Bugs and Providing Feedback

If you encounter any bugs or typos in the plugin, please report them on the GitHub issue tracker.

9. Contact Information

For questions, suggestions, or additional information, you can contact the plugin developer, Devdutta Bain, via email at devdutta.bain@gmail.com.

Thank you for using DataMapper Pro to enhance your Figma design workflow!


Updates:

2023-10-28: fixed: JSON File Upload Working, added: Frame name generation for each data, and also added stats for mapped fields, total rows etc.
plugins.tagline: Transforming Data into Art: DataMapper Pro, Your Figma Design Magic!

plugins.name: Shape Mask
plugins.description:
💬 About

This plugin allows you to add unique mask effects and custom shape cropping to images.


🌷 Key Features

  1. Various masking effects
  2. Toggle mask mode
  3. SVG upload support
  4. Custom shape cropping


💡 How To Use ?

plugins.name: Figma2UMG - Unreal Importer
plugins.description:
Figma2UMG is a powerful plugin designed to seamlessly integrate Figma designs into Unreal Engine projects by generating Unreal Motion Graphics UI Designer (UMG) files. With Figma2UMG, developers and designers can easily import Figma assets, including UI designs, icons, and graphics, directly into their Unreal Engine environment. The plugin simplifies the workflow between design and development teams, allowing for efficient collaboration and rapid prototyping. Figma2UMG supports the import of Figma files while preserving frames, components, groups, and other design elements, ensuring fidelity and accuracy during the transition from design to implementation. Whether creating immersive experiences or interactive applications, Figma2UMG empowers developers to bring their Figma designs to life within Unreal Engine with ease. This plugin utilizes the Figma REST API and requires an access token for authentication.




The importer will be released in Unreal Marketplace.

For now, you can support its development at https://www.patreon.com/Figma2UMG
plugins.tagline: Unreal Engine Importer

plugins.name: Get It
plugins.description:
Get It helps in building Figma plugins by letting you prototype pieces of your plugin in Figma and copy their verbose syntax to your clipboard. 

Want to get the fill syntax for a hex value or a complex gradient to use in your plugin? Select a node with the fill you want and run `Get It > Get Fills` and you now have a usable fill syntax in your clipboard.

Writing a complex drop shadow in your plugin? Quickly build it in Figma and run `Get It > Get Effects` and you have you’ll have the full effect syntax in your clipboard

Don’t know the exact font name for the font you want to load? Create a text node and assign the font you want then run `Get It > Get Font` and, you guessed it, the correct font name syntax will be in your clipboard. 

Creating a layout grid within your plugin? Do it visually in Figma and run Get It > Get Layout Grid.  💥 Layout grid syntax in your clipboard.

What you can currently get for a selected node:

- Fills
- Strokes
- Effects
- Font Name
- Text Styles
- Dimensions
- Offsets
- Layout Grids
- Constraints

Note: The selected node must have the property set on it to get it, for example, a rectangle node will not return a font name.

plugins.name: Design-to-Motion Generator
plugins.description:
Design to Motion - Animate Figma Elements to GIF By Yashitech Solutions

Design to Motion is a powerful animation plugin that converts your static Figma designs into engaging animated GIFs effortlessly. Perfect for creating design presentations, demos, and social media content.

Key Features:

  1. Multiple Animation Types: Fade, slide, scale, rotate, and bounce effects
  2. Customizable Settings: Control duration, delay, easing, and direction
  3. High-Quality Exports: Export GIFs in various qualities up to 1080p
  4. Flexible FPS Options: Select between 24, 30, or 60 fps
  5. Background Color Control: Customize animation background
  6. Preview & Reset: Test animations before exporting
  7. Batch Processing: Animate multiple elements at once
  8. Smart SVG Handling: Optimized processing for better performance


Perfect for:

  1. UI/UX Designers
  2. Product Designers
  3. Marketing Teams
  4. Design Presentations
  5. Social Media Content
  6. Product Demos
  7. Design Documentation
  8. Interactive Prototypes


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to animate
  2. Click "Scan Selection" to import them
  3. Choose your animation settings
  4. Preview the animation
  5. Export as GIF in your desired quality


Technical Specifications:

  1. Multiple export qualities (400p to 1080p)
  2. Variable frame rates (24-60 fps)
  3. Optimized SVG processing
  4. Batch element processing
  5. Smart memory management


Note: This plugin is part of the Yashitech plugin suite, along with HTML to Figma and Figma Inspect Styles.
plugins.tagline: Figma designs into smooth animated GIFs with customizable effects, transitions, and high-quality.

plugins.name: Font Replace
plugins.description:
Elevate your design projects with Font Replace for Figma and FigJam, the ultimate solution for seamless font management and customization. This powerful plugin enables designers to efficiently detect, replace, and manage fonts within their Figma files, ensuring consistency and enhancing the overall design workflow. Whether you’re updating a project with a new brand font or ensuring text uniformity, Font Replacer makes the process effortless and precise.


Features:


  1. Layer Selection: Easily select specific layers within your Figma file to initiate the font replacement process, streamlining your workflow.
  2. Font Detection: Automatically identify and list all fonts used in the selected layer, including font group names and font weights, for comprehensive management.
  3. Font Replacement: Search for and select new fonts to replace existing ones. Font Replacer supports the simultaneous replacement of multiple fonts, saving you time and effort.
  4. Text Style Application: Apply new fonts to the text styles within the selected layer, ensuring consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Free Usage and Upgrade Option: Start with a limited number of free tries and upgrade to unlimited usage, offering flexibility to suit your needs.
  6. License Management: Unlock unlimited usage by entering your license code and gain access to premium customer support for any issues or inquiries.
  7. User Notifications: Stay informed with notifications about your usage limits and easily upgrade to continue using the plugin without interruptions.
  8. Customer Support: Reach out to our dedicated support team for assistance with any plugin-related concerns, ensuring a smooth and productive experience.


Why Choose Font Replace?


Font Replacer is designed to provide designers with a robust tool for managing and customizing fonts within Figma. Whether you're working on a single project or managing multiple designs, Font Replacer offers the precision and efficiency needed to maintain consistent typography across all your work.


Get Started Today!


Download and install Font Replace from the Figma Community Store and enhance your design workflow with the power of efficient font management and customization.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Manage and Customize Fonts with Font Replace for Figma and FigJam..

plugins.name: Brandify: White-Label Enabler & Theme Switcher
plugins.description:
Features


  1. Single click swap: Real-Time, Error-Free swapping of color styles, logos, and images.
  2. Google Sheet Integration: Syncs client branding through API.


Instructions:


  1. Duplicate Google Sheet: Duplicate the provided Google Sheet template. Maintain the same naming convention for column headers in the Google Sheet and add your color styles values. Copy and paste the components from the "Copy These Components" section of this file into your desired Figma file.
  2. Upload Logos and Images: Upload your logos and images to imgur.com. Copy the direct links of the uploaded images and paste them into the appropriate columns in the Google Sheet.
  3. Create API:  Go to sheetdb.io and create an API using your Google Sheet link.
  4. Configure Plugin: Paste the generated API link into the designated field in the Settings tab of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Branding Made Simple, Switching Themes Made Easy.
